questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You are planning a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You need to recommend a Teams Phone solution for a sales team of 20 users. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• The team must be assigned a single dedicated phone number.
• An auto attendant must be used for inbound and outbound PSTN calls.
• Each member of the sales team must NOT be assigned their own phone number.

Which Teams Phone feature should you include in the recommendation, and how many Calling Plan licenses should you recommend assigning? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
eature: Shared Calling
Calling Plan Licenses: 1 license assigned to the resource account

Shared Calling allows a group of users, such as a sales team, to share a single phone number for making and receiving calls. It aligns perfectly with the requirement for the sales team to have one dedicated phone number and not assign individual phone numbers to each member.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You need to recommend a Teams device that meets the following requirements:

• Displays a single-button layout that forwards calls to a specific user
• Supports video by default for the calls
• Displays a custom message

Which type of device should you recommend?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
You need a Teams device that meets these three requirements:

1️⃣ Single-button layout for call forwarding ✅
2️⃣ Supports video calls by default ✅
3️⃣ Displays a custom message ✅

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams deployment.

Users in the marketing department at your company report that they cannot use their Teams client to schedule a town hall meeting.

You plan to use PowerShell to resolve the issue.

Which PowerShell cmdlet should you run first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
New-CsTeamsMeetingBroadcastPolicy:
This cmdlet is used to create a new meeting broadcast policy, but it doesn't apply to existing users or assign the policy. You'd use Grant-CsTeamsMeetingBroadcastPolicy to assign the policy.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams deployment that has Teams Premium licenses.

You create and assign an enhanced encryption policy for sensitive Teams meetings.

Which meeting feature is available in an encrypted meeting?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Explanation:
Enhanced encryption for Teams meetings (available with Teams Premium) provides end-to-end encryption (E2EE) for sensitive meetings.
When a meeting is end-to-end encrypted, many features are restricted for security reasons.
Available Feature in an Encrypted Meeting:
✅ Screen sharing – Allowed in encrypted meetings.

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is: A. breakout rooms
In an encrypted Teams meeting, breakout rooms are the feature that remains available, while features like recording, Copilot, and potentially screen sharing might be restricted.

comments.content: Wrong, only audio, video and screensharing is available. Please see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/end-to-end-encrypted-meetings
